questions.text: Who played John Wilkes Booth in the original Off-Broadway production?
questions.explanation:
Victor Garber.

	Indeed, Victor Garber played the charismatic, personable young Booth.

questions.text: Who gives the assassins their guns?
questions.explanation:
Proprietor.

	Suprisingly, it is not Hasselhoff but the Proprietor of the carnival game that gives the assassins their guns as he sings "Everybody's Got the Right."

Hinckley and Fromme.

	Hinckley sings to Jodie Foster and Fromme sings to Charles Manson.

questions.text: Who did Czolgosz try to kill?
questions.explanation:
William McKinley.

	Czolgosz killed President McKinley at the Pan-American Exposition in Buffalo.

questions.text: According to "the Gun Song," what do you have to do to change the world?
questions.explanation:
Move Your Little Finger.

	"All you have to do is move your little finger."  Just a little finger can change the world.

Electric Chair.

	Zangara was electrified for killing Mayor Cermak and shooting at President-Elect Franklin Delano Roosevelt.

questions.text: According to the "Ballad of Guiteau," where is Guiteau going?
questions.explanation:
to the Lordy.

	"I am going to the Lordy, I am so glad."  Charles Guiteau is just a little crazy.

Santa Claus Costume.

	Sam Byck is wearing a Santa Claus outfit and he tried to kill President Nixon by hijacking a plane and crashing it into the White House.

questions.text: Who did Byck contact before his assassination attempt?
questions.explanation:
Leonard Bernstein.

	Byck's letter to Bernstein details his crazy plan.

questions.text: In the show, who is the last President to be killed?
questions.explanation:
John F. Kennedy

	In a very powerful scene, the other assassins convince Lee Harvery Oswald to shoot JFK.
